Description: THROUGH THIS GRANT CLAFLIN UNIVERSITY (CU) AND SUBAWARDEE COLLEGES/UNIVERSITIES WILL BE ENHANCING AND FOSTERING A SUSTAINABLE AND DIVERSE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATH (STEM) WORKFORCE. THROUGH THE TECHNOLOGY CURRICULUM AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (CPDP) AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS SHARED INTEREST RESEARCH PROGRAM (SIRP) CU WILL PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONALLY ENGAGED SCIENTIFIC AND ENGINEERING WORKFORCE TO CONDUCT BASIC RESEARCH THAT WILL LEAD TO FUTURE CAREER PATHWAYS IN THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY EM COMPLEX FOR UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS.

THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (DOE-EM) IS ENHANCING AND FOSTERING A SUSTAINABLE AND DIVERSE DOE-EM WORKFORCE STEM PIPELINE. THROUGH THE TECHNOLOGY CURRICULUM AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (CPDP) AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS SHARED INTEREST RESEARCH PROGRAM (SIRP).

MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM (MSIPP) GRANT FOR NORTHWEST INDIAN COLLEGE. THROUGH THE TECHNOLOGY CURRICULUM AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (CPDP) AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS SHARED INTEREST RESEARCH PROGRAM (SIRP) NWIC WILL PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONALLY ENGAGED SCIENTIFIC AND ENGINEERING WORKFORCE TO CONDUCT BASIC RESEARCH THAT WILL LEAD TO FUTURE CAREER PATHWAYS IN THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY EM COMPLEX FOR UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS.

THE FAMU S-PEP IS DESIGNED TO PROMOTE ENROLLMENT, PERSISTENCE AND TIMELY GRADUATION FOR STEM
MAJORS THROUGH A SERIES OF ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES THAT: 1.) EXPOSES STUDENTS TO WORLD CLASS RESEARCH VIA A SERIES
OF COLLOQUIA, 2.) ENGAGES STUDENTS BY PROVIDING PROFESSIONAL NETWORKING, MENTORING AND RESEARCH
OPPORTUNITIES AND 3.) PROVIDES ACADEMIC SUPPORT THROUGH SUPPLEMENTAL INSTRUCTION (SI).

TOTAL PROJECT $527,339

DOE WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON WITH THE TEXAS SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY AS A PARTNER TO CONDUCT A 3 YEAR PILOT PROGRAM TO IMPROVE MINORITY ENGAGEMENT THROUGH INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN THE ENERGY SECTOR. THE TOTAL ESTIMATED PROJECT COST OF THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OVER THE ENTIRE 36 MONTH PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS $527,339. CONSISTENT WITH THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY, OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT WILL BE TO:

(1)DEVELOP A CAMPUS SUPPORT SYSTEM BETWEEN THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON AND TEXAS SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY; (2) DEVELOP A CORE CURRICULUM IN INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP; (3) ADMINISTER A SIX WEEK SUMMER PROGRAM ON BUSINESS PLAN_ DEVELOPMENT BASED UPON DOE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY; AND ( 4) PROVIDE MENTORSH 1 P TO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP. SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT IS ANTICIPATED BETWEEN DOE AND THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON DURING THE PERFORMANCE OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. DOE WILL SHARE IN THE OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES FOR DIRECTION OF THE PROJECTS AND WILL PARTICIPATE SIGNIFICANTLY IN MEETINGS AND CONDUCT PERFORMANCE REVIEWS OF ACTIVITIES.

DOE AND UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON (UH) AND TEXAS SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY (TSU) ON A THREE-YEAR PROJECT TO IMPROVE MINORITY ENGAGEMENT IN INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN THE ENERGY SECTOR. UH HAS A SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD IN SUPPORTING DOE'S MISSION AND EXECUTING INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP PROGRAMS. THE PROJECT HAS THE FOLLOWING FEATURES: 

• DEVELOP A CAMPUS SUPPORT SYSTEM BETWEEN THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON AND TEXAS
SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY; .
• DEVELOP A CORE CURRICULUM IN INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP;
• ADMINISTER A SIX WEEK SUMMER PROGRAM ON BUSINESS PLAN DEVELOPMENT BASED UPON
DOE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY; AND
• PROVIDE MENTORSHIP TO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN INNOVATION AND ENTRE

FLORIDA INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY TO ALIGNING WITH THE RESEARCH AND ECONOMIC IMPACT MISSION AND STIMULATE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT NEAR COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS (MSIS).
UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO TO CONDUCT A NATIONAL HISPANIC RESEARCH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM

FORT VALLEY STATE UNIVERSITY COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENTAL ENERGY PROGRAM (CDEP) FOR PREPARING UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITIES FOR STEM CAREERS IN ENERGY TO ENROLL A COHORT OF SIX ACADEMICALLY TALENTED FRESHMEN STUDENTS INTO ITS FIVE-YEAR 3+2 DUAL DEGREE STEM PROGRAM. FVSU WILL PARTNER WITH GEORGIA TECH, UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS RIO GRANDE VALLEY, UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT AUSTIN, UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS, UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA AT LAS VEGAS, AND PENN STATE UNIVERSITY TO FACILITATE A 3+2 DUAL DEGREE PROGRAM THAT WILL BE BENEFICIAL IN YIELDING GRADUATES FOR AMERICA’S STEM WORKFORCE.  FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS FOR SIX STUDENTS OVER THE FIVE YEAR PERIOD AT A COSTS OF $15,766.00 PER STUDENT. OVER FIVE YEARS A TOTAL COST OF $499,790 FOR THE PROJECT.
DEVELOP THE WORKFORCE DIVERSITY TOOLKIT

DOE AND THURGOOD MARSHALL COLLEGE FUND WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO INCREASE UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH TRAINING, GRADUATION AND PURSUIT OF GRADUATE EDUCATION FOR THE STUDENTS ENROLLED AT THURGOOD MARSHALL COLLEGE FUND COLLEGE IN THE STEM FIELDS. THESE PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) SCHOLASTIC SUPPORT TO SUSTAIN STEM EDUCATION: TO ESTABLISH THE DOE SCHOLARS PROGRAM TO TALENTED UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WHO ARE PURSUING DEGREES IN STEM AND ENERGY RELATED DISCIPLINES IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THEM THE NECESSARY TRAINING AND ASSIGNMENTS TO HELP THEM BETTER ENGAGE IN THESE FIELDS. THIS SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM WILL ENABLE THE STUDENTS TO CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION BY FULFILLING SOME OF THEIR FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS TO REMAIN ENROLLED IN COLLEGE; (2)NATIONAL LABORATORY ENGAGEMENTS BY STUDENTS AND FACULTY: TO BUILD UPON NATIONAL LABORATORY AND OTHER CORE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT CENTERS TO PROVIDE SUMMER ENRICHMENT PROGRAMS FOR STUDENTS AND FACULTY TO ENGAGE WITH SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS AT THESE NATIONAL LABORATORIES TO GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE ON THE SCOPE OF THE TECHNICAL MISSION AND DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROFESSIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR CAREERS IN THE STEM WORKFORCE; AND (3) PARTICIPATION IN THE ANNUAL THURGOOD MARSHALL LEADERSHIP AND TRAINING INSTITUTE TO PROVIDE CAREER TRAINING AND COUNSELING AND PROFESSIONAL RECRUITMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS.  THE STUDENTS WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN INTERNSHIPS WITH STEM MENTORS AND RECEIVE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR STEM SCHOLARSHIPS.  INTERNSHIP MENTORS WILL PROVIDE LEADERSHIP AND SUPPORT FOR TRAINING INITIATIVES WITH THE NATIONAL LABORATORY.
NM-MESA STUDENT LOYALTY PROJECT
THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE WASHINGTON NATIONALS YOUTH BASEBALL ACADEMY WITH THE WASHINGTON NATIONALS STEM LAB PROJECT.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS RIO GRANDE VALLEY TO CONDUCT HISPANIC ENGINEERING, SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY WEEK (HESTEC) ACTIVITIES INCLUDING A
REGIONAL SCIENCE BOWL IN SOUTH TEXAS.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMENDMENT IS TO ISSUE A CONTINUATION AUTHORIZATION FOR BUDGET PERIOD 2, AND PROVIDE INCREMENTAL FUNDING.
